intro: Senecio macrospermus, commonly known as the large-seeded senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, featuring narrow, gray-green leaves with a fuzzy texture. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense, daisy-like clusters. Senecio macrospermus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
